benchmark_details.name: PLUGH
benchmark_details.overview: PLUGH is a benchmark designed to evaluate spatial understanding and reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) through five distinct tasks based on fictional texts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the spatial reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models using a formalized set of tasks derived from narrative texts.

data.source: Data extracted from 48 different games, comprising 5 tasks with 125 input texts representing 61 different spatial graphs.
data.annotation: Automatically generated from game transcripts and processed using LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model output comparison with ground truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance, while lower normalized Levenshtein distance signifies closer matches to expected paths or graphs.
methodology.baseline_results: Results across various models are provided, demonstrating performance variability.
methodology.validation: Data validation included checks for location presence in generated text and duplicates in graphs.
